page.title: 15GRID SQUARE DESCRIPTION
page.content: The following notes give a brief description of the main points of interest for each grid square .We hope to give readers the feel of what each square Km.was like in l985. 9238:mainly permanent pasture for sheep. This area has rounded hills (max height 215m.)Berry Hill Farm and Leyden House only dwellings.Main Stone-Longton road passes through the N.W. corner. 9237:Main settlement is Knenhall .Very wooded(45%) Moddershall Oaks. Electricity pylons from nearby Meaford coal-fired power station.Max height 225m. 9236:contains linear village of Moddershall with approx 30 houses.Chapel,pub and riding school. The riding school is used by young people from the surrounding urban areas.Plans have also been put forward to expand the tourist potential of the
